question: When calculating the System Average Interruption Duration Index (SAIDI), which of the following formulas should be used according to IFRS standards?
optionA: Total number of customers interrupted / Total number of customers served
optionB: (Total number of customers interrupted × Duration of interruptions) / Total number of customers served
optionC: Total duration of interruptions / Total number of customers interrupted
optionD: (Total number of customers served × Duration of interruptions) / Total number of customers interrupted
optionE: Total number of customers served / Total number of customers interrupted
answer: B. (Total number of customers interrupted × Duration of interruptions) / Total number of customers served
reference: IFRS S2 Climate-related Disclosures Appendix B Industry-based disclosure requirements

question: According to IFRS standards, how should an electric utility calculate the percentage of its electric load served by smart grid technology?
optionA: By dividing the number of smart meters installed by the total number of customers
optionB: By measuring the reduction in peak demand attributed to smart grid technologies
optionC: By calculating the total amount of energy load served by smart grid technology divided by the total amount of energy load
optionD: By assessing the percentage of grid infrastructure that incorporates digital communication technologies
optionE: By determining the ratio of renewable energy sources integrated through smart grid systems
answer: C. By calculating the total amount of energy load served by smart grid technology divided by the total amount of energy load
reference: IFRS S2 Climate-related Disclosures Appendix B Industry-based disclosure requirements: Electric Utilities & Power Generators

question: When reporting on greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions associated with power deliveries, which of the following should be included in the calculation according to IFRS standards?
optionA: Only emissions from owned power generation facilities
optionB: Emissions from owned generation and purchased power, minus emissions from power resold at wholesale
optionC: Emissions from owned generation, excluding those associated with transmission and distribution losses
optionE: Emissions from owned generation, purchased power, and customer-owned distributed generation
answer: B. Emissions from owned generation and purchased power, minus emissions from power resold at wholesale
reference: IFRS S2 Climate-related Disclosures Appendix B Industry-based disclosure requirements: Electric Utilities & Power Generators

question: According to IFRS standards, how should an electric utility calculate the Customer Average Interruption Duration Index (CAIDI)?
optionA: Total duration of interruptions divided by the total number of customers
optionB: Total number of customer interruptions divided by the total number of customers served
optionC: Sum of all customer interruption durations divided by the total number of customer interruptions
optionD: Average duration of interruptions multiplied by the frequency of interruptions
optionE: Total number of customers interrupted divided by the total number of interruption events
